### Replacement Lighting - Outdoor - Grand Valley Institution

#### Solicitation Number: 21465-24-4277707
#### Amendment Number: 4
#### Publication Date: October 13, 2023

#### Description:
The Correctional Service of Canada, Grand Valley Institution, invites qualified and experienced electricians to submit a bid for the replacement of outdoor lighting fixtures and installation of new energy-efficient luminaires.

The scope of work involves the removal and disposal of 29 existing light bases, poles, and luminaires, and the supply and installation of new light bases, poles, and luminaires at Grand Valley Institution. The contractor must provide all necessary personnel, tools, services, supplies, materials, supervision, and equipment to complete the work within 12 weeks from the date of contract award.

#### Requirements:
- The contractor must be a licensed electrician with experience in energy-efficient lighting installation.
- The contractor must remove and dispose of existing light bases, poles, and luminaires.
- The contractor must supply and install new light bases, poles, and luminaires.
- The new lighting fixtures must be energy-efficient luminaires.

#### Evaluation Criteria:
- The lowest bid will be evaluated based on price, while considering the entire scope of work, including the removal and disposal of old lighting fixtures and the installation of new energy-efficient lighting fixtures.

#### Contact:
For more information, please contact Robin Riha, Contracting Authority, at (613) 328-9727 or robin.riha@csc-scc.gc.ca.

#### Attachments:
Corresponding documents, including specifications, drawings, and contract language, can be found at the following links:

- English: [Link 1](https://example.com/path/to/download)
- French: [Link 2](https://example.com/path/to/download)

#### Notice:
The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).

After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process. Bidders should make the request to the Contracting Authority within 15 working days of receipt of the results of the bid solicitation process.

This notice is a public notice inviting tenders for the purchase of goods or services from private industry. Bidders are encouraged to obtain the complete statement of work and evaluation criteria by downloading the solicitation document and associated documents from CanadaBuys.gc.ca. The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
